general_advisory: In paddy crop, Panicle initiation, Panicle emergenc e, flowering and milking stages are the critical stages. In these stages water scarcity or deficit of water causes comparatively greater reduction in yields. Cover the rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Top-dress with 4% potassium to protect crop from water scarcity during summer. Apply sprinkler irrigation to bring down the heat effect. Conserve upto 50% water by irrigating alternate rows. The high temperature increases the water requirement of maize crop. Irrigate the crop. Never allow water to remain stagnant for more than six hours in the field. Spread polythene in irrigation channels to save water wastage during irrigation in sandy and loamy soil. High temperature in day hours may lead to wilting in tomato and brinjal. Apply 1g Streptocyclin in 10 liter water in root zone. Mulch coconut leaves 1.8 m around a coconut tree to reduce water loss. Cover with paper caps on the newly planted vegetable seedlings during day time. In shallow ponds, harvest fingerlings, if water temperature rises to 30°C. Ensure enough water depth before introducing fingerlings in a pond.

advisory: Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are critical. Avoid water deficit during these stages.
Cover the rows with dry leaves. Top-dress with 4% potassium to protect from water scarcity.
High temperature increases water requirement. Irrigate the crop. Prevent water stagnation.
High temperature may lead to wilting. Apply 1g Streptocyclin in 10 liter water in root zone.
Install pheromone traps. Spray neem-based pesticide in case of infestation.
Mulch coconut leaves 1.8 m around a coconut tree to reduce water loss.
Cover with paper caps on the newly planted seedlings during day time.
Harvest fingerlings if water temperature rises to 30°C.
Check the migration of caterpillars. Use appropriate insecticides for control.
After harvesting, cut the tops and dry the bulbs in a well-ventilated room.
To control mango hoppers, spray the recommended insecticides.
